instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not turning on after changing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
board was working fine. but keyboard was liquid damaged, somekeys didnt work. so i changed the keyboard. so i thought might as well change <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> while the board is out.

after i changed <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>. now the board doesnt boot. the cpu does get warm and fan doesnt spin, mouse get red light. no video.
it see the battery, can charge the battery.

pin1 of <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> is now shorted to GND. even i remove this cap, pin1 is still shorted to GND.
pin1 and pin2 of L9560 is shorted to GND.


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.57v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_CPU_IMVP_ISNS</SIGNAL> 12.57v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.413
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.3
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> - 3.3



did i killed the cpu or gpu??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not turning on after changing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
What is the resistance in Ohm reading? And did you try a different cap? 
I've replaced quite a bunch and never damaged anything. Were you blowing hot air inwards towards the board or outwards?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not turning on after changing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message: Did you use hot air? Find the short, inject voltage and see what heats up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not turning on after changing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
I did loads before and never had problem. Yes i used hot air. Yes i've tried another cap.

Ok i'll inject voltage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not turning on after changing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
pin2 of L9560 pin show 1.554v and pin 1 show 1.57v - can this be the culprit?
pin1 of <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> show 1.554v, pin2 show 0.001v

before i inject voltage...how much voltage should i be injecting?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not turning on after changing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
Uhm, I have no idea what you are doing. But if the board is powered on and there is 1.55V on <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> what is the problem? 

Please also explain to me why 0V on pin 2 of <CAPACITOR>C9650</CAPACITOR> would be fine?!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not turning on after changing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
0v on pin2 is gnd. i just telling you incase you needed to know.

pin1 is shorted to GND when there is no power. but when i plug magsafe, pin1 of <CAPACITOR>C9650</CAPACITOR> show 1.55v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not turning on after changing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
So power is fine on the rails. 
If you get a light on the mouse the board is working. Do a PRAM reset and see if you get a chime.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not turning on after changing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
i did a pram reset, still no chime and fan doesnt move.

yes pram reset goes from green then orange then green with magsafe+battery.

what should i check next?

removed ram, doesnt beep.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not turning on after changing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
[QUOTE="rany, post: 18014"]What is the resistance in Ohm reading? And did you try a different cap?
I've replaced quite a bunch and never damaged anything. Were you blowing hot air inwards towards the board or outwards?[/QUOTE]

resistance on pin1 of <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> is 125 ohm. blowing outwards


resistance should be roughly 600 ohm right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not turning on after changing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message: 125 is fine. This could be anything if it doesn't beep without RAM. You damaged something, no way to tell what. If fan does not spin there is no way there is CPU Vcore or a light on the mouse. I have no idea what is going on here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not turning on after changing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message: i need another 2850 to compare with. i get back to this board once i got another one. thanks duke
